active.description: Indicates if the Monitor is active

label.description: A label to identify the Monitor

probe_interval.description:
How often to run the monitor. Must be twice the TTL setting.
Valid values:
  * 60 – Every minute
  * 300 – Every 5 minutes
  * 600 – Every 10 minutes
  * 900 – Every 15 minutes

protocol.description:
The protocol to monitor
Valid values:
  * HTTP
  * HTTPS
  * PING
  * SMTP
  * TCP

response_count.description:
Minimum required ‘up’ agent responses to report response pool host as ‘up’. If ‘up’ responses are less than the minimum, host is set to failover.

Valid values: 0, 1, 2 or 3.

retries.description:
How many retries the monitor should attempt on failure before giving up.
Valid values:
  * 0
  * 1
  * 2

expected.description: Designate the data expected in the protocol response while monitoring the host in the pool. Maximum length: 255 bytes. Exceeding the maximum size will result in an ‘Invalid_Data’ error at run time with the message ‘Too long’. Field is case-sensitive. Exact string match required to return ‘up’ status. For HTTP(S) probes, a case sensitive sub-string to search for in the response. For SMTP probes, a string to compare the banner against. Not used for PING, or TCP protocols.

header.description:
For HTTP(S) probes, additional header fields/values to pass in, separated by the newline character (\n).
See [Configuring Monitor Headers](https://help.dyn.com/configuring-monitor-headers/) for more information on using custom headers and macros in your endpoint monitoring.

host.description: For HTTP(S) probes, a value to pass in to the Host: header.

path.description: For HTTP(S) probes, a specific path to request. Designate a path other than the root to be monitored. Paths should be supplied as a relative path to the root ‘/’ directory of the website.

port.description: For HTTP(S)/SMTP/TCP probes, an alternate connection port. Leaving the field blank means it will monitor the default port (80 for HTTP and TCP, 443 for HTTPS, and 25 for SMTP)

timeout.description: Time (in seconds) before the connection attempt times out

block.description: Options that pertain to the Monitor

automation.description:
Defines how eligible can be changed in response to monitoring.
  * auto — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Obey’. Default.
  * auto_down — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Remove’.
  * manual — Couples with eligible value to determine other serve_mode field values.

eligible.description:
Indicates whether or not the Record can be served.
  * false — When automation is set to manual, sets the serve_mode field to ‘Do Not Serve’.
  * true — Default. When automation is set to manual, sets the serve_mode field to ‘Always Serve’.

master_line.description: The value to put in the record, i.e. 1.2.3.4 for a DNS A record

record_set_id.description: The record set in which this record is added

weight.description:
Weight for the Record. Defaults to 1.
  * Valid values for A or AAAA records: 1 – 15.
  * Valid values for CNAME records: 1 – 255.

automation.description:
Defines how eligible can be changed in response to monitoring
  * auto — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Obey’. Default
  * auto_down — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Remove’
  * manual — Couples with eligible value to determine other serve_mode field values

dsf_rsfc_id.description: Identifier for the Response Pool whose Record Set Failover Chain will include this Record Set

eligible.description:
Indicates whether or not the Record Set can be served
  * false — When automation is set to manual, sets the serve_mode field to ‘Do Not Serve’
  * true — Default. When automation is set to manual, Record Set can be served

fail_count.description: The number of Records that must not be okay before the Record Set becomes ineligible

monitor_id.description: The id of the monitoring object

rdata_class.description: The type of rdata represented by this Record Set

response_pool_id.description: The response pool in which the record set is created

serve_count.description: How many Records to serve out of this Record Set

traffic_director_id.description: The traffic director in which the record set is created

trouble_count.description: The number of Records that must not be okay before the Record Set becomes in trouble

ttl.description: Default TTL used for Records within this Record Set

automation.description:
Defines how eligible can be changed in response to monitoring.
  * auto — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Obey’. Default.
  * auto_down — Sets the serve_mode field to ‘Monitor & Remove’.
  * manual — Couples with eligible value to determine other serve_mode field values

traffic_director_id.description: Traffic director id to attach this response pool

label.description: A label for the Record Set Failover Chain

response_pool_id.description: The response pool id in which we create the ressource

traffic_director_id.description: The traffic director in which we create the ressource

response_pool_ids.description: Response pools to attach to this ruleset

traffic_director_id.description: The traffic director ID in which to create the rule set

label.description: Name of the Traffic Director service

ttl.description: The default TTL to be used across the service

fqdn.description: Fully qualified domain name of a node in the zone
